project.teaser: In the modern geopolitical world, the EU and China stand in a constant dynamic relation with each other. The question in which domains EU collaboration with China is desirable, possible, or impossible is therefore the central focus of ReConnect China. To answer this question...
project.objective: In the modern geopolitical world, the EU and China stand in a constant dynamic relation with each other. The question in which domains EU collaboration with China is desirable, possible, or impossible is therefore the central focus of ReConnect China. To answer this question, this project identifies Science & Technology, Economy & Trade, Domestic Governance, and Foreign Policy as four key fields on which the EU should upgrade its independent knowledge. To that aim, it will develop a database which will provide access to new sources of information. The independent knowledge generated in this project will bring together stakeholders and experts in a Europe-China Knowledge Forum and raise awareness on China among the general public and youth. In this way, leading scientific European expertise and innovative digital technologies are mobilized to generate a deeper, sustainable understanding of contemporary China, and work towards a resilient future with China for the EU and its citizens.
project.title: ‘ReConnect China’: generating independent knowledge for a resilient future with China for Europe and its citizens.
project.keywords: Science & technology, trade, economics, governance, international relations, culture, society, outreach, networking

article.title: Enhancing the knowledge about the China of today in Europe

category.title: Project description
category.description: Article: description of linked project written by editorial team

result.title: Dissemination and Exploitation Strategy, incl, the communication Plan
result.description: The Dissemination and Exploitation Strategy will provide guidance for partners on the project communication tools and methods to be used, including project website, social media channels, and on the dissemination and exploitation pathways respecting the agreed project identity, including events, press releases, leaflets, roll-ups and the tailor-made podcast series, taking into account the target group needs and expectations.

result.title: First progress report on research clusters WP3
result.description: Annual summary of the progress made in the research clusters of WP3. Policy recommendations and findings will be presented at the ECKF conferences.

result.title: First progress report on research clusters WP4 and research workshop
result.description: Annual summary of the progress made in the research clusters of WP4 and of the thematic Research workshop on Chinese diplomacy with EU policymakers, stakeholders, experts, researchers. Policy recommendations and findings will be presented at the ECKF conferences.

result.title: First progress report on research clusters WP1
result.description: Annual summary of the progress made in the research clusters of WP1. Policy recommendations and findings will be presented at the ECKF conferences.

result.title: Second progress report on research clusters WP1
result.description: Annual summary of the progress made in the research clusters of WP1. Policy recommendations and findings will be presented at the ECKF conferences.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - ReConnect China (‘ReConnect China’: generating independent knowledge for a resilient future with China for Europe and its citizens.)
result.teaser: Context: The 2019 ‘EU-China – A strategic outlook’ defines China as ‘a partner, a competitor, and a systemic rival’ all at once. This phrasing reflects the deeper question of how the EU should position itself vis-à-vis China, a country that has not only become the...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Report on the results of Research cluster on the Economic Dimension of S&T cooperation
result.description: This report presents the results of the research cluster on the Economic Dimension of S&T cooperation along the identified axes: (1)China's acquisitions and outbound investments to the EU(2)EU's technological dependencies towards ChinaIt collates key results and conclusions reached in 2 policy papers and published the findings publicly.

result.title: Report on ECKF Conference, first edition
result.description: The ECKF Conference is a yearly meeting of leading academic and think-tank researchers on the most important strategic issues concerning Sino-European relations. Thegoal is the work towards cross-European understandings of the strategic challenges raised by China’s rise by bringing together thought leaders, highlighting state-of-the-art research, facilitating networking between leading researchers through workshops and co-creation sessions.

result.title: Report on the results of Research cluster on EU-China research cooperation (co-patent/co-publication analysis)
result.description: This report presents the results of the research cluster on EU-China research cooperation along the identified axes: (1)ST&I co-operation areas (and non-areas) related to big data and China and great power diplomacy(2)Current patterns, drivers, barriers and challenges, as well as future co-operation options between China and EU in the big data-related scientific fieldsIt collates key results and conclusions reached in 2 policy papers and published the findings publicly.

result.title: Impact Monitoring Framework
result.description: A lightweight framework system for monitoring the potential impact of the project outcomes will be detailed in a short report. This report will develop a logical framework detailing the impact monitoring dimensions and intervention logic, such as the results and outputs to be collected and tracked, the process indicators, and the methods to assess the project impacts, including the potential ways to involve partners.

result.title: Report on Europe-China Table - M18
result.description: A Foreign Affairs and Security Table brings together diplomats/defence strategists from EC and Member States and researchers who are experts in the themes addressed.

result.title: Second progress report on research clusters WP3 and research workshop
result.description: Annual summary of the progress made in the research clusters of WP3 and of the research workshop co-organised with the China team of the EU East StratCom Task Force in Brussels and Hybrid CoE in Helsinki to map out the key academic, civil society and official actors seeking to document China’s rapidly changing information manipulation activities in Europe and discussing possible responses to them at the EU level. Policy recommendations and findings will be presented at the ECKF conferences.

result.title: First progress report on research clusters WP2
result.description: Annual summary of the progress made in the research clusters of WP2. Policy recommendations and findings will be presented at the ECKF conferences.

result.title: Report on Europe-China Table - M6
result.description: The Europe-China Tables will define, answer and discuss the implications of strategic questions that require Europewide research efforts. The tables are organized once a year in the country of the chair.

result.title: Establishment of the Europe-China Knowledge Forum (ECKF)
result.description: D.5.1 establishes a central knowledge hub that allows it to pool and network expertise on China. The Forum’s main role will be to act as a knowledge-broker between key interest groups and the Europe-wide network of experts, matching the supply and demand of knowledge and facilitating joint pathways to impact. ECKF will consist of a secretariat jointly staffed by CLINGENDAEL and UTARTU.

result.title: Report on the results of Research cluster on China's Advances in Frontier Technologies
result.description: This report analyses the fundamental issues concerning China’s advancement in This report presents the results of the research cluster on China’s Advances in Frontier Technologies the along the identified axes: (1)China’s development of technologies in space (2)China and international technical standard-setting for AI(3)Quantum computing and communications technologies(4)Activities in the field of Artificial Intelligence(5)Development of AI technologies in the health sectorIt collates key results and conclusions reached in 5 policy papers and published the findings publicly.

result.title: Second progress report on research clusters WP2 and policy workshop
result.description: Annual summary of the progress made in the research clusters of WP2 and of the policy workshop on new directions in China’s economic diplomacy for government officials, diplomats, think-tank researchers and academics.Policy recommendations and findings will be presented at the ECKF conferences.

result.title: Second progress report on research clusters WP4 and research workshop
result.description: Annual summary of the progress made in the research clusters of WP4 and of the research workshop on Chinese narratives in foreign policy with EU policymakers, stakeholders, experts, researchers.Policy recommendations and findings will be presented at the ECKF conferences.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
